definition: bond (esp. document split in two, with each party holding one half)/contract/deed (i.e. title deeds)/ticket/voucher/certificate

sentences.english: My best friend won a matzo in the China Sports Lottery.
sentences.chinese: 我最好的朋友买中国运动奖券中了很多钱。

sentences.english: He bought lottery tickets from handicapped people.
sentences.chinese: 他从残疾人手中买奖券。

sentences.english: But I did win $25 that night on a lottery ticket.
sentences.chinese: 但那晚的一张奖券确实让我赢了25美元。

sentences.english: You can gain a prize by taking lotteries to an appointed place .
sentences.chinese: 你可以拿对奖券到指定的地点兑换奖品。

sentences.english: Did you see that some kid in Russia found the last golden ticket?
sentences.chinese: 你知不知道有个俄国小孩找到最后一张金奖券了？

sentences.english: Even in colonial times, the government permitted lotteries.
sentences.chinese: 即使在殖民地时代，政府允许奖券。

sentences.english: Drawing were sold in New Jersey and Georgia.
sentences.chinese: 两张百万抽奖券于新泽西和乔治亚州被售出。

sentences.english: Lottery is a tax on fools.
sentences.chinese: 奖券是向傻瓜们征的税。

sentences.english: Two winning tickets for Mega Millions Lottery Drawing were sold in New Jersey and Georgia.
sentences.chinese: 在新泽西州和乔治亚州，两张百万抽奖券已经售出。

sentences.english: A free raffle ticket is given with every receipt.
sentences.chinese: 一张收据可以得到一张抽奖券。

sentences.english: How about attaching a lottery ticket?
Duties: selling raffle tickets, directing guests, assisting fundraising and au.
sentences.chinese: 销售奖券，引导嘉宾，现场协助募捐以及拍卖活动。

definition: to draw a prize/a lottery/a raffle
to win a prize/a successful gamble
to draw the winning ticket (in a lottery)
